WorkItem.Description:
I have performed the Suggested Fix and continue to receive this error. If I am posting this message without having performed the Suggested Fix I am aware that I am consuming the Developer(s) time in managing my Issue unnecessarily.

== Version: 5.0.2.0 SL ==

== Error Message ==

[Arg_SecurityException]
Arguments: 
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=5.0.10411.00&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=Arg_SecurityException

== StackTrace ==
   at System.Net.Browser.AsyncHelper.BeginOnUI(SendOrPostCallback beginMethod, Object state)
   at System.Net.Browser.BrowserHttpWebRequest.EndGetResponse(IAsyncResult asyncResult)
   at System.Net.WebClient.GetWebResponse(WebRequest request, IAsyncResult result)
   at System.Net.WebClient.DownloadBitsResponseCallback(IAsyncResult result)

== These are the Steps that I have tried ==
When attempting to retrieve **any** character from armory, I'm greeted with the following error in chrome, ie and standalone.  I've already attempted to resolve the issue by deleting rawr data from silverlight and disabling windows firewall - both unsuccessful.

Comments.Message:
The copy/paste info looks terrible... so:

When attempting to retrieve **any** character from armory, I'm greeted with the following error in chrome, ie and standalone. I've already attempted to resolve the issue by deleting rawr data from silverlight and disabling windows firewall - both unsuccessful.

Error:
[Arg_SecurityException]
Arguments: 
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=5.0.10411.00&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=Arg_SecurityException

stack trace:
   at System.Net.Browser.AsyncHelper.BeginOnUI(SendOrPostCallback beginMethod, Object state)
   at System.Net.Browser.BrowserHttpWebRequest.EndGetResponse(IAsyncResult asyncResult)
   at System.Net.WebClient.GetWebResponse(WebRequest request, IAsyncResult result)
   at System.Net.WebClient.DownloadBitsResponseCallback(IAsyncResult result)

Same problem, I Cannot import characters:
   in System.Net.HttpWebRequest.EndGetResponse(IAsyncResult asyncResult)
   in System.Net.WebClient.GetWebResponse(WebRequest request, IAsyncResult result)
   in System.Net.WebClient.DownloadBitsResponseCallback(IAsyncResult result)

Same here.  I've been getting the SecurityException for a day or so now.

Just for background, I'm on a Mac and therefore using the web version rather than the standalone.  The problem appears on Safari, Chrome and Firefox.  I've tried clearing the Silverlight data associated with Elitist Jerks, restarting browsers, restarting the machine and doing a disk permissions repair all with no result.  Both machines I have tried it on have the same issue.  Problem occurs on both the US and EU armouries.

All in all, seems like it may be external, i.e., Blizzard have changed something in the armoury.
This should be fixed now, let me know if it continues.
Yes the issue has definitely been resolved.  Thank you very much for the quick response :D  As soon as i get finished with work here, ill be donating to the project, you guys are awesome!
Confirmed working again for me too.
